data.meta_description: This is the timeline for the Marvel Animated Universe. It includes the television shows X-Men, Spider-Man, Iron Man, Fantastic Four, The Incredible Hulk...
data.text:
This is the timeline for the Marvel Animated Universe. It includes the television shows X-Men, Spider-Man, Iron Man, Fantastic Four, The Incredible Hulk, and X-Men '97.

Iron Man, Fantastic Four and The Incredible Hulk are a shared universe, set in Earth-534834. X-Men, Spider-Man and X-Men '97 are set in Earth-92131. Spider-Man features crossovers with Iron Man and Fantastic Four, while Fantastic Four features Juggernaut crawling out of the ocean after Gladiator threw him in X-Men. The X-Men cameo in Fantastic Four with a similar design. There are many continuity errors between the two universes, including completely different presidents, a contradictory history for Sasquatch, and Captain America's presence.

X-Men '92: House of XCII features an explanation that connects the X-Men '92 comics (previously confirmed to be set in Earth-92131 before it was retconed to Earth-15730) to X-Men '97 by introducing a secondary mutation where Jubilee's consciousness is sent back to her birth whenever she dies, thus splitting the timeline. In that story, she is on her 10th and final life, but it is jump-started by the Phoenix Force, only this time she has no memory of her previous lives and can no longer reincarnate.

This gives an explanation for how these two timelines have direct crossovers. They are part of the same broadstrokes timeline though occur in different incarnations of Jubilee's life.

Timeline Reasoning

All flashbacks not noted here are estimated.

X-Men 5x13 is a flashback episode to Mr. Sinister's origin. It states it takes place in 1888.

Spider-Man 5x04 flashbacks are stated to begin in 1942. It's assumed that this is referring to the creation of the super soldier serum.

Spider-Man 4x02 flashback is stated to take place in 1943. Steve Rogers becomes Captain America.

X-Men 5x07 is a flashback episode to 1944.

Spider-Man 5x04 flashbacks are assumed to end in 1945 due to Captain America traditionally getting trapped in 1945. Captain America and Red Skull are trapped in the time vortex.

The X-Men 2x05 and X-Men 3x01 flashbacks to Wolverine's origin are taken to take place as late as possible to make the ages seem most plausible. Since Omega Red was imprisoned for 25 years and Wolverine fought him with his claws, this is the latest point.

In X-Men 2x04, Omega Red states that they was imprisoned for 25 years. This has to be when the Wolverine fight took place. Wolverine has his suit and claws, so this must take place after X-Men 2x05's flashbacks.

X-Men 4x09 gives a precise date of May 11th, 1959.

In X-Men 4x14, Nightcrawler states that he was born 25 years ago. This places the X-Men 4x08 flashback in 1970.

Micro states that he and Frank have been vigilantes since the Vietnam war. It is assumed that his family died shortly after U.S. involvement ended.

In X-Men 3x18, Corsair stated his plane was attacked 20 years ago, thus 1974.

In X-Men 4x11, it is stated that Charles has known Moria for 20 years, then it is later stated "almost" 20 years. 19 years seems appropriate. In X-Men 4x13, it is stated that the flashback is 20 years ago. Its placement is directly connected with the Moria and Magneto flashbacks.

Walter Stark is said to have died 10 years prior to Iron Man 2x04, placing flashbacks from that episode and 1x11 in 1985.

X-Men 3x11 flashbacks feature a Sunday September 8th newspaper, which matches 1991.

Tony must have become Iron Man after 1992 due to Bill Clinton being president in flashbacks during Iron Man 1x11.

X-Men '92

X-Men '92 Vol. 1/Infinite Comics takes place on Battleworld after the destruction of the multiverse following 2015's Secret Wars. Similar events to this story occurred in Earth-15730. Because of this, it is included with a [Battleworld] note to clarify it's place.

Iron Man S1/Fantastic Four S1

Iron Man 1x01 begins on a hard March 11th date. It takes a whole year for the sailers to be transformed into the undead. There is a March 11th, 1994 date, but it is unclear whether this is referring referring to the first 5 minutes or present day. Iron Man 1x02 has a Fantastic Four comic book, meaning that they must be existing heroes by this point. Iron Man 1x08 references events from Iron Man 1x09-1x10, thus takes place after. Bill Clinton is president in Iron Man 1x09, and he served between 1993 and 2001.

Fantastic Four 1x03 takes place before the modern day portions of Fantastic Four 1x01-1x02 due to 1x01 providing a flashback to a previous encounter with Namor the Sub-Mariner, who they first met in 1x03. A civilian is wearing an Iron Man t-shirt in Fantastic Four 1x12. There is an in-universe Iron Man TV series in Fantastic Four 1x13 with Ultimo as the villain, placing that episode after Iron Man 1x02.

X-Men S1

In, X-Men 1x11 Bishop states it is Monday, the 11th. This corresponds with May 1992. It must be much later after the previous episodes due to the X-Mansion being restored since its destruction in X-Men 1x08. X-Men 1x13 is set immediately after the last two. Near the end, a calendar can be seen on October 18. Further supporting 1992, it is a presidential election year.

X-Men S2

In X-Men 2x01, Xavier states that they saved Kelly "last year", placing this season in 1993. There is not a lot of time that passes in this season, since each episode happens shortly after one another.

X-Men S3/Spider-Man S1

From this moment onwards, the show was released out of order. This timeline follows the script order, which, according to series writer Steven Melching, is the "best guide in terms of overall series continuity, as this is how the stories were originally envisioned to flow together."

In X-Men 3x08, a New York City Comic Con poster is up, going from Friday to Sunday. In 1994, this occurred between February 11-13. Spider-Man 1x03 takes place "months" after Spider-Man 1x02. Newspapers in Spider-Man S1 date the year as 1994. Flashback to Spider-Man's origin must take place before X-Men 3x07 due to his small cameo.

All newspapers in Spider-Man state Saturday, even when the previous date had a Saturday newspaper. As a result, some of these may be discarded.

X-Men S4/Spider-Man S2-3

X-Men 4x14 is set on Halloween.

X-Men 4x17 is set on Christmas Eve.

Newspapers in Spider-Man S2 date the year as 1995. 2x07 takes place a week after 2x03. This season seemingly takes place over a short period of time. In Spider-Man 2x09, a newspaper is dated 1996. Seeing as how this season is over a very short period of time, it means that, to span 1995 and 1996, it must be set in December/January. Taking the Saturday newspaper dates that can work from 2x03 and 2x09 into account, as well as the Thursday date from 1x01, we can give this season very precise dates. Some Saturday newspapers from 1x01 and 1x03 have to be ignored. A "night" scene in 2x13 is just a visual continuity error due to it beginning in day, then turning to night, then it being day again in less than 30 minutes in-universe.

Coincidently, the Spider-Man/X-Men crossover fits better after Wolverine's arc from 4x11 to 4x16, seeing as how Jean mentions how he should know that everyone has their own private pain more than anybody.

In X-Men 4x18, Forge states that "the only trace indicators (of Time Travel) point to the North-eastern United States, in the late 1990s", fitting with the 1996 placement.

X-Men S5/Spider-Man S4-5

Newspapers in Spider-Man S3 and S4 date the year as 1996.

X-Men '97 S1

X-Men '97 is said to pick up following the conclusion of the previous series.
